intro: Rhexia tortuosa, commonly known as the zigzag root or zigzagged rhexia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to reddish-purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has a distinctive, winding root system that gives it its common name. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Rhexia tortuosa is often found in rich, loamy soils and thrives in partial to full shade.
